Regression¶

class Decision_Tree(max_depth=None, min_node_count=1, bins=False, step=10)¶

Simple Decision Tree for regression

build_tree(x, y, depth=0)¶
fit(X, Y)¶
Parameters

  • X (ndarray) – Training x data

  • Y (ndarray) – Training y data

get_split(X_train, Y_train)¶
map_one_exemplar(sample)¶
class Gaussian_Process(kernel='Gaussian', seed=0)¶

Numpy Gaussian process with simple gradient descent (using momentum).

Gaussian_Kernel(X1, X2)¶
fit(X, Y, alpha=1, epochs=100, momentum=0.8, prior_c=1)¶
Parameters

  • X (ndarray) – Training x data

  • Y (ndarray) – Training y data

  • alpha (float) – Parameter to scale the gradient (Default is 1)

  • epochs (int) – Number of training iterations (Default is 100)

  • momentum – Parameter to scale the momentum term for convergence (Default is 0.8)

  • prior_c – Prior on the constant terms in the likelihood (Default is 1)

grad_descent(alpha, epochs)¶
p_Y_star(X, cov)¶
class K_Neighbours_Regressor(k=5, p=2, weight='distance')¶

K Nearest Neighbours Regressor, optimised with scipy KDTree

  • X (ndarray) – Training x data

  • Y (ndarray) – Training y data

class Random_Forest(n_trees=4, weight='OOB', bag_ratio=0.7, feature_ratio=0.7, min_node_count=3, bins=False, max_depth=None, step=10, threads=4)¶

Parrelelised implementation of the above decision tree regression model

fit(X, Y)¶
Parameters

  • X (ndarray) – Training x data

  • Y (ndarray) – Training y data

class Regression(intercept=False)¶

Simple (penalised) linear regression

fit(X, Y, p=0)¶
Parameters

  • X (ndarray) – Training x data

  • Y (ndarray) – Training y data

  • p (float) – Value for penalisation term (Default is 0 - corresponding to OLS regression)

class tfGP(distribution='Gaussian', process_y=True, variable_l=False, dtype=tf.float64, jitter=1e-08)¶

Gaussian process implemented in Tensorflow:

create_model(x, y, *args)¶
fit(x, y, params, kernel='Squared Exponential', lr=0.01, iterations=2000, verbose=True)¶
Parameters

  • x (ndarray) – Training x data

  • y (ndarray) – Training y data

  • params (list) – List of hyperparameters [Noise_var, Signal_var, Lengthscale - May be float or list for individual penalisation]

  • kernel (str) – Choice of kernel. options [‘Squared Exponential’, ‘Periodic’] (Default is ‘Squared Exponential’) Note: ‘Poission’ likelihood must use Periodic kernel

  • lr (float) – Learning rate in training (Default is 0.01)

  • iterations (int) – Number of training iterations

  • verbose (Bool) – Boolean for descriptive prints

init_variable(value, positive=False, multi=False)¶
optimise(lr, iterations, verbose)¶
periodic_kernel(t_X1, t_X2, *args)¶
posterior_pred(x)¶
predict(x)¶
Parameters

x (ndarray) – Test x data

sq_exp_kernel(t_x1, t_x2, *args)¶
